top_comments_top.body:
As a reminder, this subreddit [is for civil discussion.](/r/politics/wiki/index#wiki_be_civil)

In general, be courteous to others. Debate/discuss/argue the merits of ideas, don't attack people. Personal insults, shill or troll accusations, hate speech, any suggestion or support of harm, violence, or death, and other rule violations can result in a permanent ban. 

If you see comments in violation of our rules, please report them.

 For those who have questions regarding any media outlets being posted on this subreddit, please click [here](https://www.reddit.com/r/politics/wiki/approveddomainslist) to review our details as to our approved domains list and outlet criteria.

***


*I am a bot, and this action was performed automatically. Please [contact the moderators of this subreddit](/message/compose/?to=/r/politics) if you have any questions or concerns.*
Everytime I think about this (debt cancellation) I cannot fathom the reason for delay.
This is fox news garbage, even if the headline seems appealing.  As if they support her or what she stands for.
I'll give Biden permission and I'm a whole lot cooler than Manchin.

How about first cancelling the debt of people who are facing bankruptcy due to enormous health care costs - because they got sick and needed care?  Getting sick can happen to anybody; and the reason for sickness is quite often hereditary. You might argue that individuals with student loans should have thought about the debt they incurred when they got the loans (just like anybody else who borrows they should understand loans must be repaid). Also, it doesn't seem fair to students who worked several jobs to pay for their education or for parents who saved and made enormous sacrifices to pay for their children's education so the children would not have to be burdened by student loans.
